intro: Deprea sawyeriana subsp. valladolidana, commonly known as the Valladolidan deprea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions in Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive yellow-orange flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure, which set it apart from other members of the species. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
